title: Verena Keller
text:
Verena Keller (born 1945 in <a href="Zurich">Zurich</a>) is a Swiss actress and writer.
Life.
Keller is the daughter of the publicist <a href="Franz%20Keller%20%28psychologist%29">Franz Keller</a>. After her studies at the <a href="Zurich%20University%20of%20the%20Arts">Bühnenstudio Zürich</a> she went to the <a href="German%20Democratic%20Republic">German Democratic Republic</a> in 1967, where she worked as a theater actress. At the end of the 1970s she returned to Switzerland, where she worked as an actress, cultural journalist and language teacher. In 1986, Keller was the director of the asylum in 's feature film "Das kalte Paradies" ("The Cold Paradise").
In her novel "Silvester in the Milchbar", published in 2014, she describes her time as an actress, especially in <a href="Quedlinburg">Quedlinburg</a>. Among other things, she could not be recruited by the <a href="Stasi">Stasi</a> and represented <a href="human%20socialism">human socialism</a> as an illusion.
Her novel "Papi, wo bist du?" ("Daddy, where are you?"), published in 2015, deals with her father, the psychologist <a href="Franz%20Keller%20%28psychologist%29">Franz Keller</a>, who left Switzerland as a Swiss <a href="communist">communist</a> in 1945 to get involved in the construction of the <a href="German%20Democratic%20Republic">German Democratic Republic</a>. In 2017, she published her travel report on a motorcycle tour on <a href="U.S.%20Route%2066">Route 66</a> from Los Angeles to Chicago, "L.A. ruft".
